publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-3839 Gil Paterson: Supporting our Local Businesses—That the Parliament congratulates the Scottish Government on the implementation of the second phase of the Small Business Bonus Scheme, which will see business rates abolished for up to 120,000 small businesses and a reduction for another 30,000; believes that small businesses are at the heart of thousands of communities across the country and it is vital that they are retained; considers the financial boost that this will give to small businesses, local high streets and the Scottish economy during this Downing Street downturn, and looks forward to the introduction of the Town Centre Regeneration Fund to further support Scotland’s small businesses.
S3M-3839 Supporting our Local Businesses (lodged on 31 March 2009) Jamie Hepburn*

S3M-3839 Supporting our Local Businesses (lodged on 31 March 2009) Stewart Maxwell*, Christina McKelvie*, Sandra White*, Joe FitzPatrick*, Kenneth Gibson*, John Wilson*, Bill Kidd*, Ian McKee*, Stuart McMillan*

S3M-3839 Gil Paterson: Supporting our Local Businesses—That the Parliament congratulates the Scottish Government on the implementation of the second phase of the Small Business Bonus Scheme, which will see business rates abolished for up to 120,000 small businesses and a reduction for another 30,000; believes that small businesses are at the heart of thousands of communities across the country and it is vital that they are retained; considers the financial boost that this will give to small businesses, local high streets and the Scottish economy during this Downing Street downturn, and looks forward to the introduction of the Town Centre Regeneration Fund to further support Scotland’s small businesses. Supported by: Jamie Hepburn, Stewart Maxwell, Christina McKelvie, Sandra White, Joe FitzPatrick, Kenneth Gibson, John Wilson, Bill Kidd, Ian McKee, Stuart McMillan, Michael Matheson*, Brian Adam*
S3M-3839 Supporting our Local Businesses (lodged on 31 March 2009) Anne McLaughlin*
